critique: The document centralizes authority in the Director of the Office of Personnel Management to review and approve pay increases for certain employees of the Department of Veterans Affairs and other agencies. It aims to ensure that pay increases are in the best interest of the Federal Government and are competitive with non-Federal health-care facilities. The document does not directly address ideological tilt, immigration, security vs. liberty, or social inclusion. It has a moderate impact on economic regulation and federalism, and a slight impact on executive power.
